alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 29 at 3:04AM CST until January 29 at 11:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...SNOW ENDING BUT BITTER COLD WIND CHILLS PERSIST... .Snow was exiting the area early this morning with general amounts in the 3 to 6 inch range. There will still be some snow covered roads so use caution when traveling today. Wind chills will be below -20 for several hours this morning across parts of southeast Minnesota and northern Iowa. With these wind chill temperatures, frostbite can occur in 30 minutes or less. Wind chill advisories may be needed again over the next several nights. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Mitchell and Floyd Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 11 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
